trans-unit.source: Unplugged: Two heads are better than one
trans-unit.target: アンプラグド： Two 表 are better than one

trans-unit.source:
Materials: A penny for each student, paper and pencils
Most students have used a penny to decide something.
trans-unit.target:
必要なもの： A penny for each student, paper and pencils
Most students have used a penny to decide something.

trans-unit.source: Ask for some examples.
trans-unit.target: Ask for some examples.

trans-unit.source: Who goes first in a game, to break a tie, to decide which activity to do...
trans-unit.target: Who goes first in a game, to break a tie, to decide which アクティビティ to do...

trans-unit.source: A simple penny is the most common binary decision making tool ever!
trans-unit.target: A simple penny is the most common binary decision making tool ever!

trans-unit.source: When you flip a coin to decide something there are only two possible outcomes, heads or tails.
trans-unit.target: When you flip a coin to decide something there are only two possible outcomes, 表 or 裏.

trans-unit.source: When you flip a coin the outcome is random.
trans-unit.target: When you flip a coin the outcome is random.

trans-unit.source: What’s a common issue with coin tosses?
trans-unit.target: What’s a common issue with coin tosses?

trans-unit.source: Students may bring up issues of trust and fairness.
trans-unit.target: Students may bring up issues of trust and fairness.

trans-unit.source: Who gets to flip the coin?
trans-unit.target: Who gets to flip the coin?

trans-unit.source: Who gets to ‘call’ it?
trans-unit.target: Who gets to ‘call’ it?

trans-unit.source: What if it’s a ‘faulty’ coin?
trans-unit.target: What if it’s a ‘faulty’ coin?

trans-unit.source: Here’s a solution...
trans-unit.target: Here’s a solution...

trans-unit.source: The double coin toss.
trans-unit.target: The double coin toss.

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/booleans/pennies.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/booleans/pennies.png

trans-unit.source: Two pennies showing heads and tails
trans-unit.target: Two pennies showing 表 and 裏

trans-unit.source: In a double coin toss, both people have a coin and they flip the coins at the same time.
trans-unit.target: In a double coin toss, both people have a coin and they flip the coins at the same time.

trans-unit.source: Working in pairs, have the students make a table or list of the possible outcomes if each student flipped a coin at the same time.
trans-unit.target: Working in pairs, have 生徒たち make a table or list of the possible outcomes if each student flipped a coin at the same time.

trans-unit.source: Example:
trans-unit.target: Example:

trans-unit.source: Coin A Coin B ============== Heads Heads Heads Tails Tails Heads Tails Tails
trans-unit.target: コインA コインB ============== 表 表 表 裏 裏 表 裏 裏

trans-unit.source: There are 4 possible outcomes.
trans-unit.target: There are 4 possible outcomes.

trans-unit.source: For 2 outcomes, the result is the same for both coins, both heads or both tails.
trans-unit.target: For 2 outcomes, the result is the same for both coins, both 表 or both 裏.

trans-unit.source: For the other 2 outcomes, the result for each coin is different, heads/tails and tails/heads.
trans-unit.target: For the other 2 outcomes, the result for each coin is different, 表裏 and 裏表.

trans-unit.source: So, if 2 coins are flipped, the chance that the outcomes will be the same (HH/TT) is equal to the chance that the outcomes will be different (HT/TH).
trans-unit.target: So, if 2 coins are flipped, the chance that the outcomes will be the same (HH/TT) is equal to the chance that the outcomes will be different (HT/TH).

trans-unit.source: Both outcomes, coins the same/coins are different have a 2 in 4 or 50% chance of occurring.
trans-unit.target: Both outcomes, coins the same/coins are different have a 2 in 4 or 50% chance of occurring.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, if Person A wins each time the outcomes are the same and Person B wins each time the outcomes are different, both have an equal chance of winning each double coin flip.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, if Aの人 wins each time the outcomes are the same and Bの人 wins each time the outcomes are different, both have an equal chance of winning each double coin flip.

trans-unit.source: With this system, no one person’s outcome, heads or tails, guarantees a win.
trans-unit.target: With this system, no one person’s outcome, 表 or 裏, guarantees a win.

trans-unit.source: If Person A’s coin flips to heads, she would win if Person B also flipped heads, but lose if Person B flipped tails.
trans-unit.target: If Aの人’s coin flips to 表, she would win if Bの人 also flipped 表, but lose if Bの人 flipped 裏.

trans-unit.source: Students will usually see that this is a fair system.
trans-unit.target: Students will usually see that this is a fair system.

trans-unit.source: Let the students experiment with this.
trans-unit.target: Let 生徒たち experiment with this.

trans-unit.source: Have students flip their coins together, keeping track of the outcomes, perhaps by adding another column to their table.
trans-unit.target: Have students flip their coins together, keeping track of the outcomes, perhaps by adding another column to their table.

trans-unit.source: Example:
trans-unit.target: Example:

trans-unit.source: Coin A Coin B Totals ======================== Heads Heads Heads Tails Tails Heads Tails Tails
trans-unit.target: コインA コインB Totals ======================== 表 表 表 裏 裏 表 裏 裏

trans-unit.source: Just for fun, have them play to a certain total number of rounds.
trans-unit.target: Just for fun, have them play to a certain total number of rounds.

trans-unit.source: So, what does this have to do Boolean variables and operators?
trans-unit.target: So, what does this have to do ブール型変数 and operators?

trans-unit.source: Think about how you would code a program a double coin flipper.
trans-unit.target: Think about how you would code a program a double coin flipper.

trans-unit.source: How would you represent each of the 4 different possible double coin flip outcomes?
trans-unit.target: How would you represent each of the 4 different possible double coin flip outcomes?

trans-unit.source: Let’s pseudocode it!
trans-unit.target: Let’s pseudocode it!

trans-unit.source: We can create a Boolean variable to represent whether an outcome is heads or tails.
trans-unit.target: We can create a ブール型変数 to represent whether an outcome is 表 or 裏.

trans-unit.source: We can make
trans-unit.target: We can make

trans-unit.source: Heads = True
trans-unit.target: 表 = true（真）

trans-unit.source:
Tails = False
Note: Tails = False can also be thought of as Tails = not true.
trans-unit.target:
裏 = false(偽)
Note: 裏 = false(偽) can also be thought of as 裏 = not true（真）.

trans-unit.source: Have the students copy their Heads/Tails table of possible outcomes, but label the columns "Coin A Heads" and "Coin B Heads" and replace each entry of ‘Heads’ with ‘True’ and ‘Tails’ with ‘False’.
trans-unit.target: Have 生徒たち copy their 表裏 table of possible outcomes, but label the columns "Coin A 表" and "Coin B 表" and replace each entry of ‘Heads’ with 「真（true）」 and ‘Tails’ with 「偽（false）」.

trans-unit.source: In the study of logic, this is known as a truth table.
trans-unit.target: In the study of logic, this is known as a truth table.

trans-unit.source: We’ll use it to help us pseudocode our program, by adding a third column describing the results of each outcome.
trans-unit.target: We’ll use it to help us pseudocode our program, by adding a third column describing the results of each outcome.

trans-unit.source:
```  Coin A Coin B Results Heads Heads
================================================================================== True True If Coin A is true AND Coin B is true, add one to Player A score True False If Coin A is true AND Coin B is false, add one to Player B score False True If Coin A is false AND Coin B is true, add one to Player B score False False If Coin A is false AND Coin B is false, add one to Player A score
trans-unit.target:
```  コインA コインB Results 表 表
================================================================================== true（真） true（真） If コインA is true（真） AND コインB is true（真）, add one to プレイヤーA score true（真） false(偽) If コインA is true（真） AND コインB is false(偽), add one to プレイヤーB score false(偽) true（真） If コインA is false(偽) AND コインB is true（真）, add one to プレイヤーB score false(偽) false(偽) If コインA is false(偽) AND コインB is false(偽), add one to プレイヤーA score

trans-unit.source: Can we make this code more efficient?
trans-unit.target: Can we make this code more efficient?

trans-unit.source: Can we combine any of these lines?
trans-unit.target: Can we combine any of these lines?

trans-unit.source: Try using an OR to combine both conditions in which Player A scores a point.
trans-unit.target: Try using an OR to combine both conditions in which プレイヤーA scores a point.

trans-unit.source: Do the same for both conditions in which Player B scores a point.
trans-unit.target: Do the same for both conditions in which プレイヤーB scores a point.

trans-unit.source: Give the students a chance to work this out on their own.
trans-unit.target: Give 生徒たち a chance to work this out on their own.

trans-unit.source:
Combining the conditions in which each player wins, gives us:
* If (Coin A is true AND Coin B is true) OR (Coin A is false AND Coin B is false), add one to Player A score.
trans-unit.target:
Combining the conditions in which each player wins, gives us:
* If (Coin A is true（真） AND コインB is true（真）) OR (Coin A is false(偽) AND コインB is false(偽)), add one to プレイヤーA score.

trans-unit.source: * If (Coin A is true AND Coin B is false) OR (Coin A is false AND Coin B is true), add one to Player B score.
trans-unit.target: * If (Coin A is true（真） AND コインB is false(偽)) OR (Coin A is false(偽) AND コインB is true（真）), add one to プレイヤーB score.

trans-unit.source: Note: Just as you do for math expressions with multiple operators, use parentheses to make it clear how the conditions and statements are grouped together.
trans-unit.target: Note: Just as you do for math expressions with multiple operators, use parentheses to make it clear how the conditions and statements are grouped together.

trans-unit.source: The students are by now familiar with the MakeCode blocks.
trans-unit.target: 生徒たち are by now familiar with the MakeCode blocks.

trans-unit.source: As they think through their algorithms, they may even have started to visualize the blocks they might use.
trans-unit.target: As they think through their algorithms, they may even have started to visualize ブロック they might use.

trans-unit.source: Visualizing the blocks as they pseudocode can help them with the logical steps of their program.
trans-unit.target: Visualizing ブロック as they pseudocode can help them with the logical steps of their program.

trans-unit.source: It can also help them to visualize and recognize the big picture of their code as well as the details.
trans-unit.target: It can also help them to visualize and recognize the big picture of their code as well as the details.

trans-unit.source: Using blocks to start coding these two conditionals as currently written, might look like this: ```block let CoinAHeads = false let CoinBHeads = false if ((CoinAHeads == true && CoinBHeads == true) || (CoinAHeads == false && CoinBHeads == false)) {}
Then add one to Player A score.
trans-unit.target: Then add one to プレイヤーA score.

trans-unit.source: Then add one to Player B score.
trans-unit.target: Then add one to プレイヤーB score.

trans-unit.source: Though this code will work as we want it to, it’s a lot of code.
trans-unit.target: Though this code will work as we want it to, it’s a lot of code.

trans-unit.source: It is good practice to keep your code as simply as possible.
trans-unit.target: It is good practice to keep your code as simply as possible.

trans-unit.source: Let’s see how we can do just that.
trans-unit.target: Let’s see how we can do just that.

trans-unit.source: Booleans and simplifying code
trans-unit.target: Booleans and simplifying code

trans-unit.source: A boolean can have only one of two values: True or False.
trans-unit.target: ブール値 can have only one of two values: true（真） or false(偽).

trans-unit.source: Conditionals like 'if...then' check whether a condition is true.
trans-unit.target: Conditionals like 「もし・・なら（if...then）」 check whether a condition is true（真）.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the default condition for the 'if...then' blocks is true.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the default condition for the 「もし・・なら（if...then）」 blocks is true（真）.

trans-unit.source: In other words, the 'if...then' blocks will check to see whether whatever condition you place there is true.
trans-unit.target: In other words, the 「もし・・なら（if...then）」 blocks will check to see whether whatever condition you place there is true（真）.

trans-unit.source: basic.forever(() => { if (true) { } })
trans-unit.target: basic.forever(() => { if (true) { } })

trans-unit.source: This means that ‘If CoinAHeads’ is the same as ‘If CoinAHeads = true’. We can use this to simplify our code.
trans-unit.target: This means that ‘If CoinAHeads’ is the same as ‘If CoinAHeads = true（真）’. We can use this to simplify our code.

trans-unit.source: Instead of:
trans-unit.target: Instead of:

trans-unit.source: we can code:
trans-unit.target: we can code:

trans-unit.source: Also, since ‘If not CoinAHeads’ is the same as ‘If CoinAHeads = False’, instead of:
trans-unit.target: Also, since ‘If not CoinAHeads’ is the same as ‘If CoinAHeads = false(偽)’, instead of:

trans-unit.source: let CoinAHeads = false if (CoinAHeads == false) {}
trans-unit.target: let CoinAHeads = false(偽) if (CoinAHeads == false(偽)) {}

trans-unit.source: we can code:
trans-unit.target: we can code:

trans-unit.source: let CoinAHeads = false if (!CoinAHeads) {}
trans-unit.target: let CoinAHeads = false(偽) if (!CoinAHeads) {}

trans-unit.source: So now we have:
trans-unit.target: So now we have:

trans-unit.source: Can we simplify it even more?
trans-unit.target: Can we simplify it even more?

trans-unit.source: For this particular program, since we are checking to see if the conditions CoinAHeads and CoinBHeads are the same, whether both true or both false, we can use a logic equals block to simplify our code to:
trans-unit.target: For this particular program, since we are checking to see if the conditions CoinAHeads and CoinBHeads are the same, whether both true（真） or both false(偽), we can use a logic equals block to simplify our code to:

trans-unit.source:
Then add one to Player A score.
What about our other big block of code for the conditions for a Player B win? We could simplify that to:
trans-unit.target:
Then add one to プレイヤーA score.
What about our other big block of code for the conditions for a プレイヤーB win? We could simplify that to:

trans-unit.source:
Then add one to Player B score.
We don’t need to do this! Since the only other option to being equal is to be not equal, we can simply do this:
trans-unit.target:
Then add one to プレイヤーB score.
We don’t need to do this! Since the only other option to being equal is to be not equal, we can simply do this:

trans-unit.source: Random functions
trans-unit.target: Random functions

trans-unit.source: We use a coin flip to decide things because the result is random, meaning the result happens without any conscious decision or direction.
trans-unit.target: We use a coin flip to decide things because the result is random, meaning the result happens without any conscious decision or direction.

trans-unit.source: We use dice and game spinners for the same reason.
trans-unit.target: We use dice and game spinners for the same reason.

trans-unit.source: The results are not predetermined or directed in any way.
trans-unit.target: The results are not predetermined or directed in any way.

trans-unit.source: So, how do we get a random flip in code?
trans-unit.target: So, how do we get a random flip in code?

trans-unit.source: Most computer programming languages have a built in function that will select a random number given a range of values.
trans-unit.target: Most コンピュータ プログラミング languages have a built in function that will select a random number given a range of values.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft MakeCode has a block for this.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft MakeCode has ブロック for this.

trans-unit.source: And it also has a block for getting a random true or false value.
trans-unit.target: And it also has ブロック for getting a random true（真） or false(偽) value.

trans-unit.source: We will call on this built in function to get a random true or false value for each flip of a coin in the next activity.
trans-unit.target: We will call on this built in function to get a random true（真） or false(偽) value for each flip of a coin in the next activity.

trans-unit.source: Our basic pseudocode for our 'double coin flipper' could look like this:
trans-unit.target: Our basic pseudocode for our 'double coin flipper' could look like this:

trans-unit.source: Use the random function to get a true/false value for Coin A.
trans-unit.target: Use the random function to get a 真・偽の値 for コインA.

trans-unit.source: Use the random function to get a true/false value for Coin A.
trans-unit.target: Use the random function to get a 真・偽の値 for コインA.

trans-unit.source: Compare the current values of Coin A and Coin B.
trans-unit.target: Compare the current values of コインA and コインB.

trans-unit.source: If the current true/false values of Coin A and Coin B are the same, add a point to Player A’s score.
trans-unit.target: If the current 真・偽の値 of コインA and コインB are the same, add a point to プレイヤーAの得点.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the current true/false values of Coin A and Coin B must be different, so add a point to Player B’s score.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the current 真・偽の値 of コインA and コインB must be different, so add a point to プレイヤーAの得点.

trans-unit.source: When players are done with their double coin flipping, show the final scores for each player.
trans-unit.target: When players are done with their double coin flipping, show the final scores for each player.
